column4: so... I'm in my xorg.conf file.. now how do I change my screen resolution? I'm sorry but I really do need like step by step instructions here, I'm a total newb to linux and all this technical stuff
Right at the very bottom, you'll see a section about "Display" with aload of depths/modes in it, with resoultions in side ""
yeah I see it, what do I do with it?
Check what the number is after DefaultDepth, usually 24, go down to the modes line under  Depth 24 section add the resolution you want before the others listed in the same format
I just type in what I want in "s and then the option will be there?
I added 1280x1024 to the modes under the default depth and its still not an option in system/preferences/screen resolution
Basically copy and paste your entire xorg.conf into that website :)
Then send the link this way :)
you're my hero. thanks a bunch man :P
